summary:
I'm a technology leader, software architect, and tech strategist with 19+ years of experience building and delivering software, creating strategies, leading teams, coaching, and mentoring.

My current focuses are architecture, digital transformation, and technical strategy.

I have a track record of delivering global strategies, and big-impact business initiatives, building and growing engineering organizations, and designing highly scalable solutions.

I believe in taking a broad perspective when designing and optimizing processes and ways of working in project and program management. This is why I have, over the past decade, completed a number of pieces of training and education for different methodologies, including LSS, Scrum (Mastera and PO), and Kanban.

My architecture approach is influenced by TOGAF, evolutionary architecture, and risk-driven architecture styles.

As a coach-style leader, I empower individuals to grow and foster a supportive team culture.

treasury_media.title: Rastko Vukasinovic · tech blog
treasury_media.description: Architect, Tech lead and platform guy at adidas and Reebok ecom.

school.name: Faculty of Physics, University of Belgrade

education.field_of_study: Computer and Information Sciences and Programming

projects.title: HomeStory Platform
projects.description:
Vast.com's real estate application system serving real estate search applications for various partners throughout US.

As a central part of HomeStory ecosystem of applications, platform provides search, analytics and user related home search features packed in the configurable container that can easily be shipped with new design and enabled features.

Developed in all modern JavaScript stack (ExpressJS, ReactJS, PostCSS, CSS Modules, Webpack...) and running on NodeJS 6, HS platform is one of the Vast.com's most advanced applications, and most certainly one most plans are revolving around.

contributors.headline: Application Technical Delivery Owner at Kickdrum
UI Designer & Front-end developer at Vast.com
VP of Engineering at RealStaq, Inc.
Director Project Delivery at HomeStory Serbia

projects.title: HomeStory agent application (pilot)
projects.description:
Pilot that started HomeStory ecosystem, this application is giving real estate agents tools necessary to improve their sales process.

App provides agents with rich in detail and well represented data about properties that they are selling so they can utilize these in their sales process. App has advanced search feature, multiple agent specific features for organizing and saving properties and highly sophisticated analytics for each property, its location and other necessary data that someone would need to make real estate purchase decision.

This web application is built on ExpressJS with UI in Backbone, handlebars, SCSS...

contributors.headline: UI Designer & Front-end developer at Vast.com
Staff Software Engineer at Vast (Acquired by Vroom Jan 2021)
VP of Engineering at RealStaq, Inc.
Application Technical Delivery Owner at Kickdrum

projects.title: 'Rewrite' of Ivy Exec application
projects.description:
I guided development of front end application layer of new, recently released IvyExec application and was included in dev-ops part of the project, during the course of the project I was working on development and planning in almost all aspects of it:

► I was one of four people involved in planning the project, mostly in charge of defining front end technology stack.

► Designed the structure of front end application layer and most of the major front-end features.

► Developed all the core Javascript libraries, and API integrations in front end. 

► Had some influence on back end architecture (e. g. design of abstract entity for the service layer) 

► Did some PHP development, on front end (controller/view layer and various helpers) and back end (service layer mostly)

► Was involved in planning and creating CI system (automations, deployment/release process, testing, reporting ...)


 After hierarchy gap appeared, caused by Head of IT leaving the company on short notice, I was acting as projects tech lead and communicator for the team for several months, in this period,we managed to keep the project on track, recruit and train new engineers to work on project.

projects.title: Introducing modern application development and delivery workflow
projects.description:
Introduction of workflow based on git-flow branching model into SVN based enviroment, also adopting the model for continuous code review and QA process friendly implementation.

This project also included introduction of Capistrano as deployment tool and developing system allowing QA team to test separate git branches before even getting to test it on dev branch.

I did mapping of the workflow, in-team training while preparing team for switching to git, required documentation and implementation planning and overseeing. I was also working with sysadmin and qa on development of custom capistrano recepies to accommodate needs of the process.

profile_positions.description:
As a global solution architecture leader, I take charge of the holistic tech strategy and global horizontal initiatives. I advocate for innovation, an evolutionary approach to architecture development, and effective (data-driven) decision-making.

Key responsibilities:

- Developing global tech strategies for adidas digital tech
- Leading global horizontal initiatives across adidas digital tech
- Ensuring the alignment of business and technology strategies
- Driving and supporting architecture, design, and software delivery plans across different product areas as part of the value-stream or other crosscutting structure.
- Acting as the primary consultant and advocate for senior leadership on architecture and design topics within my area.  
- Leading the architecture team, providing mentorship and coaching, and acting as a line manager.
- Overseeing technical risk management efforts
- Optimizing return on investment (ROI) for all technology-related decisions and initiatives.
- Acting as one of the core members of global CoP group

I'm involved from the initial stages of business strategy and technology ideation, coordinating with diverse stakeholders. This ensures that proposed solutions are well-aligned with our organization's goals, technical roadmap, and standards. I focus on guiding my team toward innovation, best practices, and developing the skills necessary for successful solution delivery.
profile_positions.title: Solution Architecture Lead (Strategy, practice, and chapter)

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:

- Leading Backend Software Engineering, QA, and SRE Chapters, the first two in the interim while developing and hiring leads.
- Implementing SRE practices, driving the roadmap, and owning the backlog for DevOps/SRE tooling and technology adoption in the area.
- Driving global SRE adoption in adidas together with the core SRE leadership group.
- Taking part in planning SRE teams' growth and hiring strategies across all adidas’ tech hubs. Helping form new teams.
- Tailoring SRE approaches for different structures.
- Hiring and coaching leadership team to support growth globally (directors in all locations)
- Driving operational excellence and SRE topics across adidas IT, alone or together with other IT leaders.
- Driving and consulting on security topics in the area together with other security champions.
- Providing consultancy on various Architecture and Engineering topics, especially in the NFR space.
profile_positions.title: Director Software Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Worked in the Core team of adidas ecom as a Solution Architect and tech lead, designing software solutions and tools to be used by all parts of adidas ecom. For most of the time, I was also owning the backlog and sometimes covering agile coaching of the team.

Main responsibilities:
- Designing software solutions and features in functional ecom space (client-facing software side)
- Enabling and optimizing rollout of new solutions - re-platforming adidas e-commerce to a new more flexible headless solution with highly scalable microservice backend architecture.
- Designing and building software solutions and tools in non-functional adidas engineering space (DevOps and tech enablement side) including, CICD, development tools, software libraries, etc.

As the team grew, my responsibilities became wider and the Core team became the ecom Tech foundation team responsible for developing standards,  tools, and capabilities (including DevOps/SRE tools, automation, and APIs). 

For a year I have been a Tech and Product lead for platform area of ecom Tech Foundation area (in addition to the  Architect role) before the new wave of reteaming has created a completely new department to which I moved as Director of Software engineering.
profile_positions.title: Senior Solution Architect

profile_positions.description:
I started doing flash sites + banners and basic HTML, CSS and JS in early 2000's. I also did some c++ development with win32 API around the same time. 

Got deeper into web development after developing backend in PHP that provided XML to flash (action script) which was using it for displaying photo gallery and articles on the site. That is when I started dropping flash for javascript (it was prototype/jquery war back then)... I worked on tons of landing pages, small PHP apps, using vanilla PHP and various frameworks in backend if needed etc... Now most of these sites are down or there is NDA covering it.

In recent years I did lot less freelance web development and turned to consulting and training as freelancer. 

I also speak and write about JavaScript, Dev-ops and general programming subjecs.

Medium: https://medium.com/@metaphorical

Some of my talks:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e_hQknkOp5U
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jf1v3ulMcSU
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Cs5BoETKJg

Some of articles published elsewhere (by me and about me):

http://startit.rs/uloga-phpa-u-big-data-startapima/
http://startit.rs/rastko-vukasinovic-vast/
http://startit.rs/svi-smo-pomalo-php-programeri-novi-zamah-programerskoj-zajednici-na-solidayu/
profile_positions.title: Freelance programmer, consultant and speaker

profile_positions.description:
My general responsibilities are: working closely with product and design teams from idea to delivery, designing system and Integration, providing all necessary pre project (architecture) documentation and technical documentation for system that is being built, and leading team of engineers building the system. During the development I am primarily engaged in helping team push forward by providing guidance, participating in and moderating solution discussions, removing any obstacles and preparing detailed solutions for some of the bigger problems. I am also working on CD pipelines for the projects and Sometimes Implementing in-team processes. 

I was involved in multiple company’s projects with different responsibilities.

Two main projects:

HERO - https://herohealth.com/ as Solution Architect and project lead. My team has built core API, mobile and web application and I was involved in product design as well.

Fr8Hub - https://www.fr8hub.com as Software engineer. I have built, and designed solution for some of the components on two of Fr8Hub’s web applications. I was also involved in RnD for the project.
profile_positions.title: Principal Solution Architect

profile_positions.description:
The lead role assumed tech and team leadership and allowed me to lead teams ranging in size from 5-15 people on several projects on a few products.

 I designed and developed interesting solutions of various complexity, as well as architect web applications.

 These teams all worked on real estate domain search application projects with partners like Realogy, Capital One, Cartus, TD Bank, Keller-Williams, USAA.
profile_positions.title: Tech Lead

profile_positions.description:
✪ Senior Software Engineer | Front-end developer September 2012. - August 2013.

Web interface development and API integration.

Built web video chat platform for IvyExec's Mentorship program using SIP server, VideoIO viewports and socket based chat for text chat and exchange of SIP ids. 

PHP(Codeigniter, we did rewrite to ZF2 after), JavaScript(and jQuery + other libraries) and HTML/CSS.

✪ Team lead - Front End Development   August 2013. - March 2014.

Interface development, API integration core JS component development.

Developing, implementing and setting front end development standards, planning new technology implementation. Leading front end design and development team.

PHP(ZF2), Javascript (Vanilla, jQuery, backbone.js, qUnit, Grunt, Plato...), Twitter Bootstrap, SASS/COMPASS. 

Involved in dev-ops, mostly overseeing and improving development/delivery workflow with Git, Git-flow and Capistrano.

In charge of team entry and technology adoption training.

I also integrated few analytics, tracking and A/B testing tools - GA, Piwik, crazyegg, Optimizely.

✪ Tech consultant, front-end developer March 2014. - May 2014.

Lead developer on all Mediathlon web projects, IT consultant and member of product development team.

Mediathlon was marketing startup from Winston-Salem, NC
